items.sentence: Keep an eye on my suitcase while I buy my ticket.
Man is the only animal that can make use of fire.
I suppose everyone thinks I\'m in love with Mary.
The stream becomes shallower as you move upriver.
We\'ll get in touch with you as soon as possible.
We\'ve already eliminated half the possibilities.
Were you watching TV last night at nine o\'clock?
What color are you going to paint Tom\'s bedroom?
Tom and Mary never should\'ve done that together.
Tom is boiling the potatoes to make potato salad.
Tom is depressed because his girlfriend left him.
Have you decided where you\'re going next summer?
Have you decided who you\'ll invite to the party?
Tom is sure that he\'ll be able to pass the test.
Tom is the one who told me Mary didn\'t like him.
Tom isn\'t the only one who wants to order pizza.
Tom said he hopes Mary won\'t go home by herself.
Tom read about Mary\'s accident in the newspaper.
Tom said that French wasn\'t his native language.
You\'ll soon get accustomed to this cold weather.
Tom wished that he knew Mary\'s telephone number.
Tom won\'t be going camping with us this weekend.
Tom has been fired from every job he\'s ever had.
Tom isn\'t used to driving a left-hand drive car.
Tom parked his car on the other side of the road.
Are you going to be at this afternoon\'s meeting?
Leave it up to me. I\'ll take care of everything.
Let\'s go find a place that serves Buffalo wings.
Let\'s play cards instead of watching television.
I don\'t think I\'ve ever heard that joke before.
I don\'t think I\'ve seen you around here before.
I take it you haven\'t heard about what happened.
I teach Tom\'s children French three days a week.
I think it\'s time for me to buy a decent camera.
I think it\'s unlikely that Tom will be arrested.
You gave Tom the money he asked for, didn\'t you?
You have no idea what I\'m talking about, do you?
Tom didn\'t want to marry the farmer\'s daughter.
Tom doesn\'t know what he\'s gotten himself into.
I didn\'t like this game until I started winning.
Tom ate as soon as the food was put on the table.
Tom began skating when he was thirteen years old.
Tom began to try to lose weight a few months ago.
Tom bent down to get a closer look at the flower.
Let\'s hope that we don\'t have to do this again.
Tom cried as he read the letter he got from Mary.
Tom is much more relaxed when Mary isn\'t around.
That house is small, but it\'s big enough for us.
That movie isn\'t as interesting as the original.
Tom shoved his sunglasses to the top of his head.
